author: Mark Twain
text: Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life.

author: Confucius
text: Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life

author: Viola Davis
text: All dreams are within reach. All you have to do is keep moving towards them.

author: the Internet
text: The early bird may get the worm, but the second mouse gets the cheese.

author: the Internet
text: Living on Earth is expensive, but it does include a free trip around the sun.

author: Maya Angelou
text: You can't use up creativity. The more you use the more you have.

author: Mandy Hale
text: You do not always need a plan. Sometimes you just need to breathe, trust, let go and see what happens.

author: the Internet
text: Sell a man a fish, he will eat for a day, teach a man to fish, you will be out of a jobâ€¦

author: Mark Twain
text: In the first place, God made idiots. That was for practice. Then he made school boards.

author: Dolly Parton
text: The way I see it, if you want the rainbow, you gotta put up with the rain.

author: Thomas A. Edison
text: Many of life's failures are people who did not realize how close they were to success when they gave up.

author: Stephen Hawking
text: Life would be tragic if it weren't funny.

author: Alan Kay
text: The best way to predict the future is to create it.

author: Martin Fowler
text: Any fool can write code that a computer can understand. Good programmers write code that humans can understand.

author: Will Rogers
text: Even if you're on the right track, you'll get run over if you just sit there.

author: Oscar Wilde
text: Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much.

author: Oscar Wilde
text: Experience is the name everyone gives to their mistakes.

author: Chris Heilman.
text: Java is to JavaScript what car is to carpet.

author: Dan Salomon
text: Sometimes it pays to stay in bed on Monday, rather than spending the rest of the week debugging Monday's code.

author: Cory House
text: Code is like humour. When you have to explain it, it's bad.

author: Martin Fowler
text: You should use iterative development only on projects that you want to succeed.

author: Ralph Johnson
text: Before software can be reusable, it first has to be usable.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
text: Perfection is achieved, not when there is nothing more to add, but when there is nothing left to take away.

author: George Santayana
text: Those who do not remember the past are condemned to relive it.

author: Sheryl Sandberg
text: If you're offered a seat on a rocket ship, don't ask what seat! Just get on.

author: Henry Ford
text: Whether you think you can or you think you can't, you're right.

author: Rosa Parks
text: I have learned over the years that when one's mind is made up, this diminishes fear.

author: Wayne Gretzky
text: You miss 100% of the shots you don't take.

author: Vidal Sassoon
text: The only place where success comes before work is in the dictionary.

author: John D. Rockefeller
text: Don't be afraid to give up the good to go for the great.

author: Winston Churchill
text: Success is walking from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm.

author: James Cameron
text: If you set your goals ridiculously high and it's a failure, you will fail above everyone else's success.

author: Zig Ziglar
text: Don't be distracted by criticism. The only taste of success some people get is to take a bite out of you.

author: Oprah Winfrey
text: You know you are on the road to success if you would do your job and not be paid for it.

author: Thomas A. Edison
text: I failed my way to success.

author: Herman Melville
text: It is better to fail in originality than to succeed in imitation.

author: Ray Bradbury
text: Life is trying things to see if they work.
